definition[0]: a Boolean system is based on things that can be either true or false, but not both. It links statements with words called operators, such as AND, OR, and NOT. Boolean systems are used to write computer programs, especially Internet search programs
example[0]: The program searches for information using Boolean logic.
definition[1]: relating to a type of LOGIC in which something can be either true or false, but not both
example[1]: online systems which make use of Boolean logic
example[2]: a Boolean search (=a search for information on a computer, using Boolean logic)
